Diagnosis
	1. Sigmoid adenocarcinoma with liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic colonoscopy and biopsy
	Chemotherapy
	1 Feb - 15 Mar 2024: FOLFOX/Trastuzumab
	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver

	Current issues
	Deterioration in liver function
Worsening fatigue
Weight loss

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Colorectal MDT today. 52-year-old patient with ERBB2-amplified mucinous adenocarcinoma of sigmoid colon with multiple liver metastases. Initial presentation with change in bowel habit and weight loss. Colonoscopy showed circumferential sigmoid mass. Staging CT demonstrated multiple bilobar liver metastases, largest 6.8cm in segment 7.

Initial treatment with FOLFOX/Trastuzumab commenced February 2024. Recent CT shows progression in liver metastases with 30% increase in target lesions and development of new lesions. Deteriorating liver function with bilirubin rising to 45, ALT 156.

Performance status has declined from ECOG 1 to ECOG 2 due to fatigue and right upper quadrant discomfort. Weight loss of 6kg over 8 weeks despite dietetic support.

	MDT recommendations
	1. Switch to second-line FOLFIRI/Trastuzumab
	2. Urgent referral to palliative care team for symptom management
	3. Consider dose reduction based on liver function

	Further investigations
	Repeat LFTs in 1 week
CT assessment after 3 cycles

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg bd for 5 days

	Follow up
	Urgent oncology review next week for treatment change

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor LFTs weekly
Referral to district nurses requested
